Playing Guitar
As recreation to all the computer work, I like to play "rocky" songs on my western-guitar.
I started to learn playing guitar with a private teacher. By now, I continue to learn it autodidactic. For me, learning by doing on my own has many upsides:

children.text: I am not bound to time and can learn at my pace.
There is no need to travel to the teacher's location. I can start immediately and use my time efficiently.
And most importantly: I can play those songs, that I really enjoy. And when searching for new songs, I can better understand my current skill level. :-)

data.text: And what songs do I play? Well... the songs that I love to listen to, of course! Songs of Red Hot Chili Peppers, Sum 41, Linkin Park ... ü§ò

Photography
Every year, together my girfriend and I create a photo album about the past year. Each album includes about 100 photos that record our most memorizable and important events.

Thereby we have developed a strong passion to the photography itself. Additionaly to the "event-photography", we spend a fair amount of our spare time in nature with the landscape- and macro-photography.

Raspberry Pi
Privacy is very important to me. I wouldn't store or share privat data via Dropbox or other public cloud services.
To share files with friends, I have set up my own home cloud with a "Raspberry Pi". It provides the following services:

children.text: It runs the operation system "Raspbian", that is built upon Linux.

The firewall "nftables" impedes attacks from the internet. Only connections from Germany are permitted. In the past, I had only permitted connections from specific IPs. But that was too cumbersome, if friends with changing IPs tried to access a service.
The DNS-service "unbound" tunnels all queries to the internet. The queries are automatically encrypted with TLS and advertisement is filtered off.
The voice-chat "mumble" is used for talking.
The file-cloud "Seafile" is used to share files with friends, like cooking receipts, photos, instructions and more.

data.text: In the past, it was also running "gitea" as git-service to put my private software projects under version control and to share them. By now, all my projects have been migrated to GitHub to make them public for all.
